BR_text.BRsummary: Trouble installing / linking mlpack on Windows
BR_text.BRdescription:
Hey everyone,
 I followed the following steps to install mlpack :
 The complete file can be found <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/models/blob/2dcebdd3d5628525d473d3c0f7418be5511e24ff/.ci/windows-steps.yaml>here</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-code>cmake $(CMakeGenerator) `
      $(CMakeArgs-mlpack) `
      -DBLAS_LIBRARIES:FILEPATH=$(Agent.ToolsDirectory)\OpenBLAS.0.2.14.1\lib\native\lib\x64\libopenblas.dll.a `
      -DLAPACK_LIBRARIES:FILEPATH=$(Agent.ToolsDirectory)\OpenBLAS.0.2.14.1\lib\native\lib\x64\libopenblas.dll.a `
      -DARMADILLO_INCLUDE_DIR="..\..\armadillo-8.400.0\include" `
      -DARMADILLO_LIBRARY="..\..\armadillo-8.400.0\Release\armadillo.lib" `
      -DBOOST_INCLUDEDIR=$(Agent.ToolsDirectory)\boost.1.60.0.0\lib\native\include `
      -DBOOST_LIBRARYDIR=$(Agent.ToolsDirectory)\boost_libs `
      -DBUILD_JULIA_BINDINGS=OFF `
      -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release ..
 'mlpack/build/*.sln'
 </denchmark-code>
 
 In the Cmake mlpack was found and all other libraries required were found. However I am still facing this <denchmark-link:https://dev.azure.com/mlpack/mlpack/_build/results?buildId=1897&view=logs&j=9bb75cf0-500a-52c4-dbba-9c305edd1534&t=a4060360-b178-58da-4c70-0da5e743f9b0&l=43>error</denchmark-link>
  :
 <denchmark-code> Cannot open include file: 'mlpack/core/data/scaler_methods/min_max_scaler.hpp': No such file or directory
 </denchmark-code>
 
 The Cmake file can be found <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/models/blob/2dcebdd3d5628525d473d3c0f7418be5511e24ff/CMakeLists.txt>here</denchmark-link>
 
 Kindly help me with this, I have spent last couple of days trying to fix this. I did make some progress but I am stuck at this now.
 Thanks a lot,
 Regards.

comments_0.comment_text:
Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kartikdutt18>@kartikdutt18</denchmark-link>
  I am not sure, but do we are including the mlpack header properly <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/models/blob/2dcebdd3d5628525d473d3c0f7418be5511e24ff/.ci/windows-steps.yaml#L106>here</denchmark-link>
 ? I think so it must be .

comments_1.comment_text:
Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Yashwants19>@Yashwants19</denchmark-link>
 , I'll give it a try and Get back to you shortly.

comments_2.comment_text:
Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Yashwants19>@Yashwants19</denchmark-link>
 , That did change the error, Now this is the error
 <denchmark-code>boost_unit_test_framework-vc140-mt-1_60.lib
 (boost_unit_test_framework-vc140-mt-1_60.dll)(0,0): 
 Error LNK1112: module machine type 'x64' conflicts with target machine type 'x86'
 </denchmark-code>
 
 I saw that the boost files (x64) are copied to build folder of mlpack so I copied them to my build folder as well. So I did that but that didn't help. Sorry, I am novice with windows. Could I trouble you with this error as well?
 This is the error link on azure <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/models/pull/3/checks?check_run_id=682931198>pipeline</denchmark-link>
 .
 Regards.

comments_3.comment_text:
Cannot open include file: 'mlpack/core/data/scaler_methods/min_max_scaler.hpp': No such file or directory
 Looks like scaler_methods is missing here:
 
 
 
 mlpack/src/mlpack/core/data/CMakeLists.txt
 
 
         Lines 44 to 48
       in
       4f68502
 
 
 
 
 
 
  # Add subdirectories. 
 
 
 
  add_subdirectory(imputation_methods) 
 
 
 
  add_subdirectory(map_policies) 
 
 
 
  add_subdirectory(string_encoding_policies) 
 
 
 
  add_subdirectory(tokenizers)

comments_4.comment_text: I'll comment about the architecture issue on the PR itself.
